testing.name: Multi-Outcome Volatility Mispricing
testing.hypothesis: Multi-outcome markets with close competitors (gap <10% in underlying metric) misprice volatility, underweighting the probability of reversals. The incumbent is overpriced and challengers are underpriced.
testing.entryRules: 1. Identify multi-outcome markets where top 2 competitors are within 10% in underlying metric. 2. Calculate fair probability based on volatility scenarios. 3. If market prices challenger >50% below fair value, enter YES on challenger. 4. Only enter if >14 days to resolution (time for reversal).
testing.exitRules: 1. Take profit at 2x entry price (100% gain). 2. Stop loss at 55% decline from entry. 3. Exit 3 days before resolution if no movement. 4. Exit immediately if underlying metric gap widens to >15%.
testing.riskManagement: Max 5% of capital per position. Max 2 positions in correlated markets. Required: 14+ days to resolution, clear underlying metric for tracking.
testing.notes: First trade underwater (-19% from entry). Market trending toward incumbent despite close fundamentals. Key learning: close fundamentals â‰  close probabilities. Market may efficiently price momentum/narrative factors. Need more data before conclusions.

development.name: Single-Market Arbitrage
development.hypothesis: Polymarket markets periodically have YES + NO prices that don't sum to $1.00 due to retail order flow imbalances. These mispricings can be captured by automated detection and execution.
development.edge: Speed + automation. Retail creates mispricings; bots capture them in seconds. Top 3 arbitrage wallets made $4.2M from 10,200+ trades.
development.entryRules: 1. Monitor all active markets via WebSocket. 2. When YES + NO < 0.98 (>2% spread), buy both sides. 3. When YES + NO > 1.02, sell both sides (if holding). 4. Minimum opportunity size: $50 profit after fees.
development.exitRules: 1. Hold until resolution (guaranteed profit if entered correctly). 2. Or exit early if prices converge and can close at profit.
development.riskManagement: Max $500 per opportunity. Max 10 concurrent positions. Verify prices before execution (stale data risk). Circuit breaker: pause if 3 consecutive failed executions.

Tail-risk markets appear efficiently priced (hyp-001 invalidated)
Short-term price movements show mean-reversion, not momentum
Infrastructure gaps blocking several hypotheses (MM, leaderboard, cross-platform)
recommendations: Increase trade velocity - test hypotheses with paper money rather than endless research
Prioritize hypotheses that don't require infrastructure (hyp-007 arbitrage looks executable now)
Don't bet against market momentum without strong catalyst
Formalize more hypotheses into strategies with clear rules
